intro: Spermacoce floridana, commonly known as Florida morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, round seeds. Spermacoce floridana is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
